DOC.brief_summary: Comparison two nasal spray treatment seasonal allergic rhinitis
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Olopatadine 0.6 % Fluticasone Proprionate 50mcg Nasal Sprays Two Week Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis Trial
DOC.criteria: Inclusion : A history spring/summer seasonal allergy . Positive skin prick test currently prevalent allergen area . Confirmed absence significant anatomic abnormality , infection , bleeding , mucosal ulceration nasal examination prior administration test article . For premenopausal female , negative pregnancy test prior entry study , , sexually active , agreement use adequate birth control method throughout study . Exclusion : History chronic sinusitis . Asthma , exception intermittent asthma . Smokers . Known nonresponders antihistamine . Chronic intermittent use inhale , oral , intramuscular , intravenous dermal potent superpotent topical corticosteroid . Chronic use long act antihistamine . Upper low respiratory infection within 14 day Visit 1 . Diagnosis acute sinusitis within 30 day Visit 1 . Relatives study site staff individual access clinical study protocol . Participation investigational study within 30 day entry study concomitantly study .
